text: <@U045GJFQQ20> Did you manage to solve this?

I'm a dev <@U3T21PDBK> :smile: :smile:
Thanks for the answer, these errors occur randomly in my themes, not sure why because everything in code is fine

gotcha. Since we can’t see your code for the image / module markup its hard to say…
My guess is you have something like `class="b-{{ module.some_field_value }}"` and something is throwing an error. But I have no clue since I’m flying blind
So It only gets the default blog listing can I get a specific listing?
You need to replace "default" with the blog ID. You can add a blog selector to a listing module and grab the ID that way so you can use the same module on both listings by reconfiguring your options

Yeah, as obnoxious as the bloated dnd HTML is (and boy, is it BLOATED), it’s the exact kind of stuff that gzip or brotli can take down to nearly nothing. Looking at my network tab, the compressed HTML is only a 13.6kb download.

I’d second Byron’s comments, that `1. Dashboard(1).png`,  `2. Risks.png`, `3. Assets.png`, `4. Technologies.png` and especially `5. Graph.png` account for the majority of the page’s load time.

Since it seems like these images are pretty important, I’d suggest taking some time to manually optimize them using something like <https://squoosh.app|Squoosh>. For example, I was able to get `5. Graph.png` down from ~520kb to ~80kb by pre-scaling it to 1750x1244 and saving it at 50% quality with MozJPEG. I’m sure you could get even better results with a little bit of tuning.
hi there. has anyone here used HubSpot as db for a login functionality? if yes, how is the performance? any issues in latency in retrieving/submitting data?
